page.title: 15Life Style
page.content: Life Style. There are two public houses, The Axe and Cleaver on the main A 49.This was previously a butchers shop which has two bars a restaurant and some accomodation. The Wormelow Tump is situated on the crossroads at Wormelow and has two bars.The inn sign perpetuates the connection with King Arthur. The Pilgrim Hotel, converted from the rectory 7 years ago, has a total of 19 bedrooms with own bathroom, bar and restaurant. They serve about 150 bar snacks, 60 lunches, 100-120 dinners weekly. Park Hall Ballroom also caters for various functions and can seat 350 for dinner. Adjoining Park Hall is a Caravan Club certified site.
